ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was a really great introduction to spanish. It was accessible even though Id never taken spanish before, and we moved really fast.
I gained better knowledge of the basics of spanish language of grammar and pronunciation.

I feel much more comfortable speaking than I did before. I think the immersive classroom setting helped me to pick certain things up and become much more comfortable actually using Spanish to communicate.
I have developed important language skills to understand and converse in Spanish. I loved the amiable classroom setting and the passion that was dedicated to each class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Weakness: a lot of tedious work Strength: learned a lot
I think sometimes it jumped around a bit, and could move a little more consistently. Covering the preterite all at once would help.
A strength of this course was the instructor and a weakness was the online homework (which was often graded poorly).
One of the weaknesses of this class was the fast pace of the curriculum and not having sufficient amount of time to truly grasp the material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if the student really wants to learn spanish
Yeah for sure. Take it with Pilar Asensio if possible, shes awesome.
Yes, rigorous and effective introduction to Spanish.
Yes, this was a good and necessary course to learn the spanish language.

Yes- language is an important skill and being able to speak Spanish could be a very desirable skill. The professor is so nice and the classroom atmosphere is fun and supportive, which makes going to class exciting.
